result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:  
A.  I will pay restitution in the amount of $1000.00 to the Pepin County District Atty's office within 6 months of signing this agreement.
B.  I will not possess or consume alcohol.
C.  I will not enter bars/taverns.

supervisions.notes: Restitution ordered $1000.00 to be paid from bond on deposit in 2015CF49.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Michael Sandberg

Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court with attorney Allan Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke DPA.  Defendant agrees violation of agreement.  Court revokes agreement and find defendant guilty.

Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Here on Cont'd INIT in 15CF49 and Motion to revoke DPA in 15CM30 and a refusal.  Atty Morgan requests more time, just met with defendant. Motion hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing at 11-03-2015 02:00 pm
Motion to Revoke Deferred Acceptance of Guilty or No Contest Plea Agreement.

Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court with attorney Sarah Mae Harless.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Court advises defendant of charge/penalties in 15CM30 (criminal damage to property) and 15TR310 (OWI 1st).  Court reviews DPA in 15CM30.  Defendant pleads guilty to OWI @ .14 & criminal damage to property.  Court reviews PQWOR with DE.  DE citizen of US; Agree facts support the charge.    Court finds defendant's waiver of constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of OWI, assess forfeiture of $887.50 with 30 days to pay; revoke D/L 6 mos; AA/DSP; Defer acceptance of plea in 15CM30 and approve DPA.  Defendant updates address with court:  S322 Sand Rd, Mondovi, WI 54755.  Court dismisses 15FO21 and 15TR167.

Defendant Joshua Michael Sandberg in court with attorney Sarah Mae Harless.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights. Court advises defendant of citations, underage drinking; inattentive driving; OWI 1st. NGP entered.  Atty Harless notes jury demand request on 2 of the citations and request that request be added to the OWI.  Court notes the jury request and note request for all cases, fee paid.  State requests $500 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns; no objection by counsel.  Court sets $500 Sign.
